Welcome to DrawQubit’s documentation!¶

TeacherAPI main¶

Created on Tue Mar 10 14:55:47 2020

@author: Quantico

QubitDrawingFunctions.CreateMarks(nx=2, ny=2, dx=3000, dy=3000, PhotoLayer=2, eBeamLayer=5)¶

Create cross lithography marks on the chip.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawBiasLine(BiaslineCellName='Biasline', BiaslineLength=600, LineWidth=5, SpaceWidth=6, Tshape=True, Galvanic=False, TerminalWidth=60, Rotation=0, BigWidth=96, LauncherWidth=352, layer=2)¶

This function returns a biasline cell that contains references to one mainline (two parallel lines) cell , one launcher cell and a T-shape terminal. The cell origin is defined at the (center of the) end of the terminal.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawFourJJloop(FourJJloopCellName='4JJloop', FourJJloopLength=10.5, FourJJloopWidth=None, LineWidth=2, JJparameters={'BridgeWidth': 0.14, 'FingerLength': 1, 'FingerWidth': 0.36, 'TaperWidth': 0.5}, JJRelations=[1, 1, 1, 1], eBeamLayer=5)¶

This function returns a Four Josephson-junctions loop cell. The cell origin is defined at the center of the loop.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawFourJJqubit(FourJJqubitCellName='4JJqubit', FourJJloopLength=10.5, FourJJloopWidth=0, LineWidth=2, Spacing=20, RectangleLength=None, RectangleWidth=100, JJparameters={'BridgeWidth': 0.14, 'FingerLength': 1, 'FingerWidth': 0.36, 'TaperWidth': 0.5}, JJRelations=[1, 1, 1, 1], CircuitLayer=2, eBeamLayer=5)¶

This function returns a four-Josephson-junctions loop cell that contains references to the 4JJ (not necesserily identical) loop cell and the connections to the capacitor’s plates. It separately returns the capacitor cell (two plates placed next to the loop) together with the qubit background to be added to the resist mask. Finally it returns the qubit origin with respect to the capacitor center (2-tuple). Three junctions (usually the bigger ones) are on one branch of the loop, and the fourth is on the other. The cell origin is defined at the center of the capacitor.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawJosephsonJunction(JosephsonJunctionCellName='IndependentJosephsonJunction', LineWidth=2, FingerWidth=0.36, FingerLength=1, TaperWidth=0.5, BridgeWidth=0.14, layer=2)¶

This function returns a Josephson junction cell. The cell origin is defined at the connection with the line.

|\__ | __| |/

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawLauncher(LauncherCellName='IndependentLauncher', LineWidth=10, SpaceWidth=6, BigWidth=96, LauncherWidth=352, layer=2)¶

This function returns a launcher cell, e.g. for feedlines and biadlines. The cell origin is defined at the connection with the line element.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawRFsquid(RFsquidCellName='RFsquid', RFsquidLength=155.5, RFsquidWidth=12, LineWidth=2, JJparameters={'BridgeWidth': 0.14, 'FingerLength': 1.36, 'FingerWidth': 0.36, 'TaperWidth': 0.5}, layer=2)¶

This function returns an RFsquid cell that contains references to a line cell and a Josephson junction cell. The cell origin is defined at the center of the RFsquid loop.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawReflectionFeedline(FeedlineCellName='Feedline', MainlineLength=3000, LineWidth=10, SpaceWidth=6, BigWidth=96, LauncherWidth=352, layer=2)¶

This function returns a feedline cell (in a list) that contains references to one curved mainline cell and one launcher cell, placed on one end of the main line. The cell origin is defined at the center of the mainline.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawResonator(ResonatorCellName='Resonator', LineWidth=10, SpaceWidth=6, elongation=150, num_meanders=1, TerminalWidth=100, layer=2)¶

This function returns a list with aresonator cell that contains cell references to a feedline coupler, meander(s) and a qubit coupler. The total length of the resonator is also returned in the list. The cell origin is defined at the connection to the feedline.

QubitDrawingFunctions.DrawTransmissionFeedline(FeedlineCellName='Feedline', MainlineLength=2000, LineWidth=10, SpaceWidth=6, BigWidth=96, LauncherWidth=352, layer=2)¶

This function returns a symmetrical feedline cell (in a list) that contains references to one mainline cell and one launcher cell, placed on both sides of the main line. The cell origin is defined at the center of the mainline.

QubitDrawingFunctions.saveCell2GDS(cell, gdsName)¶

This function save the given cell to GDS file with the name ‘gdsName’
